metadata.title: CVE-2020-7067 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: In PHP versions 7.2.x below 7.2.30, 7.3.x below 7.3.17 and 7.4.x below7.4.5, if PHP is compiled with EBCDIC support (uncommon), urldecode()function can be made to access locations past the allocated memory, due toerroneously using signed numbers as array indexes.

criterions.comment: php5: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
